description:
Streptomyces parvulus is a species of actinobacteria that belongs to the genus Streptomyces. Actinobacteria are a class of Gram-positive, high-G+C content bacteria known for their ability to produce a wide range of secondary metabolites, including many clinically important antibiotics.

Streptomyces parvulus is a soil-dwelling, filamentous bacterium that forms an extensively branched mycelium. It is characterized by its ability to produce the yellow-pigmented compound undecylprodigiosin, which is a member of the prodigiosin family of natural products. These pigments have been studied for their potential antimicrobial, antitumor, and immunosuppressive properties.

The genome of Streptomyces parvulus has been sequenced, revealing its capacity to produce a diverse array of secondary metabolites beyond just undecylprodigiosin. This species is known to be a prolific producer of various bioactive compounds, making it an important subject of research in the field of natural product discovery and pharmaceutical development.
